list_definition.definition: a type of large spicy sausage that is cut into thin slices and eaten cold

list_ex_of_english: A coordinated outbreak response allowed for early identification of salami as the cause, and a health advisory and product recall to be initiated.
We accept that this is a unique opportunity to reform a system that has been salami-sliced for many years, to get the structure right.
The hypothesis-generating questionnaire was administered to 9 (75 %) of these 12 cases and 7 (77 %) reported eating salami prior to symptom onset.
Nor do we engage in salami-slicing of our objectives, because they are clearly established.
What we had was salami tactics in reverse.
We have got into the habit of having salami slices, or even wafer-thin cucumber slices, of legislation.
Our case-control study found a strong association between illness and consumption of salami made by a single producer.
However, there is also the salami-slicing approach on the other side.
